main event: On December 6, 1956, an unidentified flying object was observed over Itazuke Air Base, Japan by several military personnel.
interesting points: The object was described as circular and saucer-shaped, hovering for approximately 10 minutes before accelerating away at a high speed., Radar indicated a strange blip from the object which presented difficulties in tracking due to interference., The object was estimated to be at least 200 feet in diameter and displayed unusual speed capabilities., The incident remains classified as an unidentified flying object despite attempts to categorize it as a weather balloon., This case is noteworthy as it involved both visual and radar observations simultaneously.
witness description: military personnel at Itazuke Air Base
